sentence.Network_en: You know my vagabond and restless habits.

sentence.Network_en: Lily had no mind for the vagabond life of the poor relation.

sentence.Network_en: Why , you poor foolish , ignorant vagabond, you've been cheated, that's what!
sentence.Network_cn: 你这个缺心眼的湖涂蛋, 你受骗了, 就是这么回事.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (originally denoting a criminal): from Old French, or from Latin vagabundus, from vagari 'wander'

entry.tran: . 流浪汉;漂泊者;无业游民
entry.def: A vagabond is someone who wanders from place to place and has no home or job

means.word_mean: 1. anything that resembles a vagabond in having no fixed place;

sentences.sentence: "pirate ships were vagabonds of the sea"

means.word_mean: 2. a wanderer who has no established residence or visible means of support
1. move about aimlessly or without any destination, often in search of food or employment;

sentences.sentence: "the laborers drift from one town to the next"

means.word_mean: 1. wandering aimlessly without ties to a place or community;
2. continually changing especially as from one abode or occupation to another;
